info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 3:56AM EDT until April 9 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Charleston WV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in West Virginia...Ohio...
Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Mason and Gallia Counties.
For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ohio River at Point Pleasant.
* WHEN...From this morning to Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 42.0 feet, The Little Kyger Road in Ohio is flooded. At 43.0 feet, Ohio Route 7 at Kyger Creek and Addison is flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 37.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 42.7 feet Monday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.8 feet on 03/06/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1230 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
